INDEPENDENT SALES ORGANIZATION AGREEMENT

This Independent Sales Organization Agreement ("Agreement") is entered into as
of this [REDACTED] day of [REDACTED] , 2016 ("Effective Date"), by and between
[REDACTED] , a Delaware corporation, with a principal place of business at
[REDACTED]  ("Company", "we", "our", "us") and Card Connect, LLC,
a [REDACTED] limited liability company, with a principal place of business at 1000 Continental Drive, Suite
300, King Of Prussia, PA 19406 ("ISO", "you", "your").

RECITALS
A. Company, either directly or indirectly through one or more of the Processors (defined
below), is in the business of providing certain payment transaction processing and related services
(collectively, the "Services") to merchants with whom either Company or a Processor, as the case may
be, have entered into merchant agreements ("Merchants").
B. ISO has expertise in marketing, soliciting and qualifying potential merchant customers
for payment transaction processing and related services, and desires to perform customer support services,
marketing, solicitation, and qualification (but not final approval) of potential Merchants on behalf of
Company, and Company wishes ISO to do the same for it, exclusively for the Territory (as defined
below).
C. ISO represented to Company that it has (a) expertise in marketing card payment processing
services to, obtaining applications from, and the preliminary qualifying and screening of, merchants
who qualify to become Merchants, (b) an established sales and marketing organization in the restaurant
vertical and a proven track record of boarding profitable merchants in the Territory, and (c) the
experience and capability to meet certain volume and boarding requirements.
NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and agreements
hereinafter set forth, and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are
hereby acknowledged, the parties agree as follows:

Section 1. Definitions. All capitalized terms used in this Agreement shall have the meanings
assigned to them in this Section 1 or elsewhere in this Agreement.

(a)  "Applicable Laws" means all federal, state and local laws, rules, and regulations
applicable to the respective obligations of the parties to this Agreement, including, without limitation,
those promulgated by the Card Associations; each as may be amended and in effect from time to time
during the term of this Agreement.

(b) "Card" means a valid credit and/or debit card, as applicable, which bears the service
marks of a Card Association.

(c) "Card Associations" means VISA U.S.A., Inc., VISA International, Inc., MasterCard
International, Inc., DFS Services, LLC, American Express Travel Related Services Company, Inc.
("AMEX"), and any other card association or network organization whose Cards are from time to time
authorized by Company for use with the Services.

(d) "Cardholder" means a holder of a Card.

(e) "Confidential Information" is defined in Section 8(a).

(f) "Effective Date" has the meaning set forth in the preamble to this Agreement.

(g) "Gross Margin" means, collectively for each Merchant, the difference between (i) all
Card Association, interchange, assessment, and transaction fees for processing charged to ISO and (ii)
all revenues received from Merchants through Merchant Agreements.

(h) "Merchant" is defined in the Recitals of this Agreement.

(i) "Merchant Agreement" means a three party merchant agreement (i) among Company, a
Merchant, and a Processor; or (ii) between Company and a Merchant, as the case may be, as entered
into from time to time.

(j) "Merchant Application" means an application for the Services by a prospective
Merchant (including, without limitation, the application/registration package provided by a Processor
from time to time).

(k) "Processors" means, collectively: (i) First Data Merchant Services Corporation,
and such other of Company's payment processors.

(I) "Services" is defined in the Recitals of this Agreement.

(m) "Term" is defined in Section 9(a).

(n) "Territory" means the United States of America.

(o) "Third Party" means any person or entity other than a party to this Agreement or its
affiliates.

Section 2. Referrals.

	(a) Scope.
		(i) During the Term of this Agreement, ISO agrees to use commercially reasonable efforts to actively and diligently solicit, on a direct basis, prospective Merchants exclusively for Company within the Territory in accordance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement.
		(ii) As between the parties, Company will have the sole right to determine whether to accept any prospective Merchant referred by ISO. ISO shall not directly or indirectly provide the Services to, or solicit, induce or attempt to influence any prospective Merchant referred by ISO (or, upon acceptance by Company, any Merchent).
	(b) Exclusivity.
        (i) During the Term, ISO's relationship with Company will be exclusive with respect to the Services. Company shall have the right, in its sole and absolute discretion, to refuse to enter into any Merchant Agreement with a prospective Merchant referred by ISO.

        (ii) [REDACTED]

(c) Referrals.
        (i) ISO shall provide to Company all prospective Merchant leads and referrals
(collectively, 'Referrals"). ISO shall provide to Company all reasonably requested information to
verify and qualify any Referral. ISO shall reasonably cooperate with Company's efforts to qualify any
Referral, determine the appropriate Services to be offered (if any), and negotiate and enter into
Merchant Agreement. Company will determine, in its sole discretion, the terms and conditions of each
Merchant Agreement.

        (ii) Company shall oversee and manage, and shall have sole responsibility for, the
underwriting process for all prospective Merchants. Except as otherwise directed by Company, ISO
agrees to use the Merchant Application forms provided by company. ISO acknowledges and agrees
that: (1) it shall be fully responsible for the accuracy and completion of any information provided
by it or any prospective Merchant in, or in connection with, a Merchant Application; and (2) only
upon execution of a Merchant Agreement by Company following its receipt of a Merchant Application
and its subsequent underwriting thereof shall a prospective Merchant be deemed a "Merchant". ISO
shall not represent or suggest to any person or entity that it has any authority to bind, or otherwise
approve on behalf of Company any prospective Merchant. Company may, in its sole and absolute discretion,
accept or reject any Merchant Application.

Section 3. ISO Covenants. ISO hereby covenants to Company that it will:

a. comply with all Applicable Laws;

b. comply with all reasonable instructions and directions of Company;

c. not engage in any deceptive, misleading, illegal, or unethical practices;

d. make no false or misleading representations with regard to Company or the Services;

e. not make any representations, warranties, or guarantees with respect to the specifications,
features, or capabilities of the Services that are inconsistent with the literature distributed by Company,
or otherwise inconsistent with the terms and conditions of the applicable Merchant Agreement;

f. not make any representations, warranties, or guarantees whatsoever to Merchants or any
prospective Merchant on behalf of Company.

g. not modify, or add any additional terms and conditions to, any Merchant Application or
Merchant Agreement;

h. provide general customer assistance to Merchants and prospective Merchants, including
assisting such Merchants with the preparation and completion of all Merchant Applications, general
program education, and resolving issues relating to the Services;

i. immediately notify Company of any information that may be relevant to a Merchant's
financial standing or that such Merchant is engaging in suspicious or fraudulent activity;

j. use commercially reasonable efforts to assist Company in resolving all issues identified by
a Merchant or Company, including with respect to chargebacks, retrievals, and fraud, or as otherwise
requested by Company;

k. not accept anything of value from a Merchant in exchange for special consideration or
treatment in connection with the submission, processing, or review of a Merchant Application;

l. not obligate Company for, or engage in, the design, development, manufacture,
marketing, distribution, or sale of any product or service that violates, any Applicable Law;

m. promptly refund to Company and/or each Merchant all funds received from Company
or the Merchant that such party did not properly earn in accordance with this Agreement or the
applicable Merchant Agreement;

n. not use any Referral information other than for purposes of performing its obligations
under, and otherwise in accordance with, this Agreement;
